com.bmwcarit.barefoot.spatial

Interface SpatialOperator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Geography

    public interface SpatialOperator
    Interface of spatial operations on geometries Point and Polyline which may be implemented for different projections and coordinate systems, e.g. WGS-84 (see Geography) or UTM (not implemented yet).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a, com.esri.core.geometry.Point b, double f)
      Gets azimuth of a point on straight line defined by Points a and bby fraction f.
      double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p, double f)
      Gets azimuth of a Polyline at some point defined by fraction f, in the interval [0,1].
      double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p, double l, double f)
      Gets azimuth of a Polyline at some point defined by fraction f, in the interval [0,1].
      double distance(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a, com.esri.core.geometry.Point b)
      Gets the distance between two Points a and b.
      com.esri.core.geometry.Envelope2D envelope(com.esri.core.geometry.Point c, double r)
      Gets Envelope2D that encloses of a circular area defined by a center Point c and radius r given in meters.
      double intercept(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a, com.esri.core.geometry.Point b, com.esri.core.geometry.Point c)
      Gets interception point of a straight line, defined by Points a and b, intercepted by Point c.
      double intercept(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p, com.esri.core.geometry.Point c)
      Gets interception point of a Polyline intercepted by Point c.

      Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a straight line, defined by two points a and b.

      Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a Polyline.
      com.esri.core.geometry.Point interpolate(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p, double l, double f)
      Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a Polyline.
      double length(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p)
      Gets length of a Polyline in meters.

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        double distance(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a,
                com.esri.core.geometry.Point b)
        Gets the distance between two Points a and b.
        Parameters:
        a - First point.
        b - Second point.
        Returns:
        Distance between points in meters.

      • intercept

        double intercept(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a,
                 com.esri.core.geometry.Point b,
                 com.esri.core.geometry.Point c)
        Gets interception point of a straight line, defined by Points a and b, intercepted by Point c. The interception point is described as the linearly interpolated fraction f in the interval [0,1] of the line from a to b. A fraction of f=0 is the same as Point at a and f=1 is the same as Point b.

        Note: The coordinates of the interception point can be determined by interpolation of the fraction along the straight line, e.g. with interpolate(Point, Point, double).

        Parameters:
        a - Start point of straight line a to b.
        b - End point of straight line a to b.
        c - Point that intercepts straight line a to b.
        Returns:
        Interception point described as the linearly interpolated fraction f in the interval [0,1] of the line from a to b.

      • interpolate

        com.esri.core.geometry.Point interpolate(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a,
                                         com.esri.core.geometry.Point b,
                                         double f)
        Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a straight line, defined by two points a and b. A fraction of f=0 is the same as Point at a and f=1 is the same as Point b.
        Parameters:
        a - Start point of straight line a to b.
        b - End point of straight line from a to b.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], to be linearly interpolated on straight line from a to b.
        Returns:
        Point linearly interpolated from fraction f on a straight line of points a and b.

      • azimuth

        double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Point a,
               com.esri.core.geometry.Point b,
               double f)
        Gets azimuth of a point on straight line defined by Points a and bby fraction f. The point is defined as the linearly interpolated fraction f in the interval [0,1] of the line from a to b.
        Parameters:
        a - Start point of straight line a to b.
        b - End point of straight line from a to b.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], that defines the point on the line a to b.
        Returns:
        Azimuth in degrees from north (clockwise).

      • length

        double length(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p)
        Gets length of a Polyline in meters.
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline to be measured.
        Returns:
        Length of Polyline in meters.

      • intercept

        double intercept(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p,
                 com.esri.core.geometry.Point c)
        Gets interception point of a Polyline intercepted by Point c. This is analog to intercept(Point, Point, Point). The fraction f refers to the full length of the Polyline.
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline to be intercepted.
        c - Point that intercepts straight line a to b.
        Returns:
        Interception point described as the linearly interpolated fraction f in the interval [0,1] of the Polyline.

      • interpolate

        com.esri.core.geometry.Point interpolate(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p,
                                         double f)
        Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a Polyline. This is analog to interpolate(Point, Point, double).The fraction refers to the full length of the Polyline.
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline of interpolation.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], to be linearly interpolated on Polyline.
        Returns:
        Point linearly interpolated from fraction f on a Polyline.

      • interpolate

        com.esri.core.geometry.Point interpolate(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p,
                                         double l,
                                         double f)
        Gets Point from linear interpolation of a fraction f, in the interval [0,1], on a Polyline. This is an extension of interpolate(Polyline, double) and takes the length of the Polyline as parameter reduce computational effort.
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline of interpolation.
        l - Length of the Polyline in meters.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], to be linearly interpolated on Polyline.
        Returns:
        Point linearly interpolated from fraction f on a Polyline.

      • azimuth

        double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p,
               double f)
        Gets azimuth of a Polyline at some point defined by fraction f, in the interval [0,1]. This is an extension of azimuth(Point, Point, double).
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], that defines the point on the Polyline.
        Returns:
        Azimuth in degrees from north (clockwise).

      • azimuth

        double azimuth(com.esri.core.geometry.Polyline p,
               double l,
               double f)
        Gets azimuth of a Polyline at some point defined by fraction f, in the interval [0,1]. This is an extension of azimuth(Polyline, double) and takes the length of the Polyline as parameter reduce computational effort.
        Parameters:
        p - Polyline.
        l - Length of the Polyline in meters.
        f - Fraction f, in the interval [0,1], that defines the point on the Polyline.
        Returns:
        Azimuth in degrees from north (clockwise).

      • envelope

        com.esri.core.geometry.Envelope2D envelope(com.esri.core.geometry.Point c,
                                           double r)
        Gets Envelope2D that encloses of a circular area defined by a center Point c and radius r given in meters.
        Parameters:
        c - Center Point of the circle.
        r - Radius of the circle in meters.
        Returns:
        Enclosing Envelope2D of the circular area defined by center Point c and radius r.
